replaceAll.name: Replace Default Status Effects
replaceAll.hint: Replace all of Foundry's default status effects with Dragonbane-themed effects. Dragonbane and YZE Combat add their own effects separately. Requires reload.

showSpellEffects.name: Show Spell Effects
showSpellEffects.hint: Include spell-related status effects in the list of available effects. Requires reload.

showHeroicAbilities.name: Show Heroic Abilities
showHeroicAbilities.hint: Include heroic ability status effects in the list of available effects. Requires reload.

enableTokenHudStyling.name: Enhanced Token HUD Layout
enableTokenHudStyling.hint: Enable 6-column grid layout with section headers for token HUD status effects. Disable if you prefer Foundry's default layout or want to use custom CSS.

customEffectsEditor.name: Manage Custom Status Effects
customEffectsEditor.hint: Open the visual editor to create, edit, and manage custom status effects. Much easier than editing JSON manually.
customEffectsEditor.label: Open Custom Effects Editor

descriptionEditor.name: Edit Status Effect Descriptions
descriptionEditor.hint: Open the description editor to add custom descriptions to status effects. Useful for modules like Visual Active Effects.
descriptionEditor.label: Open Description Editor

customEditor.title: Custom Status Effects Editor
customEditor.instructions: Create and manage your custom status effects using this visual editor. Add new effects, edit existing ones, and organize your collection. Changes are saved automatically to your world settings. You can add descriptions to saved status effects in the Description Editor.
customEditor.noEffects: No custom effects yet. Click 'Add Effect' to create your first one!
customEditor.selectOrAdd: Select an effect to edit or use the Add Effect button above
customEditor.durationTooltip: Duration in seconds (e.g., 900 = 15 minutes). Leave empty or 0 for no duration.
customEditor.showBuiltinHint: Edit icons, names, durations, and categories
customEditor.editingBuiltin: Editing a built-in effect. Will override defaults.
customEditor.noEffectsVisible: No effects to display. Try checking 'Show Built-in Effects' or adding custom effects.

validation.required: Effect ID, Name, and Image are required.
validation.duplicateId: An effect with this ID already exists.

delete.title: Delete Custom Effect
delete.content:
Are you sure you want to delete the effect '{name}'? This action cannot be undone.

Make sure to Save All Effects when you are done editing effects.

resetAll.title: Reset All Effects
resetAll.content: Are you sure you want to reset all effects back to defaults? This will delete all custom effects and reset all modified built-in effects to their original settings. This action cannot be undone.

clearAll.title: Clear All Custom Effects
clearAll.content: Are you sure you want to delete all custom effects? This action cannot be undone.

reset.title: Reset Built-in Effect
reset.content: Are you sure you want to reset the effect '{name}' to its default settings? This will remove all your customizations for this effect.

import.title: Import Custom Status Effects
import.warning: This will replace all current custom effects with the imported ones.
import.confirm: Are you sure you want to continue?

notifications.saved: Effect saved successfully! Make sure to Save All Effects!
notifications.allReset: All effects have been reset to defaults! Make sure to Save All Effects!
notifications.deleted: Effect '{name}' deleted successfully! Make sure to Save All Effects!
notifications.reset: Effect '{name}' has been reset to default settings.
notifications.hidden: Effect has been hidden from Token HUD.
notifications.shown: Effect is now visible in Token HUD.
notifications.saveError: Failed to save custom effects. Please try again.
notifications.exportFailed: Failed to export custom effects. Please try again.
notifications.importError: Failed to import custom effects. Please try again.

errors.invalidFile: Invalid file format: missing or invalid effects array

editor.title: Status Effect Description Editor
editor.instructions: Add custom descriptions to your status effects. These descriptions will be used by Visual Active Effects and other modules that display status effect information. You can drag items, actors, or journal entries from Foundry directly into the description fields to create clickable links. Note: After saving, existing effects on tokens must be removed and reapplied to show the new descriptions.
editor.placeholder: Enter a description for this status effect... You can also drag items, spells, or journal entries here to create links.

import.title: Import Status Effect Descriptions
import.warning: This will replace all current descriptions with the imported ones.
import.confirm: Are you sure you want to continue?

clearAll.title: Clear All Descriptions
clearAll.content: Are you sure you want to clear all status effect descriptions? This action cannot be undone.

notifications.exportFailed: Failed to export descriptions. Please try again.
notifications.importSuccess: Successfully imported {count} effects ({nonEmpty} with descriptions)! Make sure to Save All Effects!
notifications.importError: Failed to import descriptions. Please try again.
notifications.linkFailed: Failed to create link from dropped item

errors.invalidFile: Invalid file format: missing or invalid descriptions object

errors.notArray: Custom Status Effects: Must be an array of effects
errors.invalidFormat: Custom Status Effects: Invalid format - must be an array of effects
errors.invalidJSON: Custom Status Effects: Invalid JSON format

warnings.systemCompatibility: Dragonbane Status Effects module is designed for the Dragonbane system. Some status effects may not work as expected.

notifications.customEffectsCleared: Custom effects cleared. Reload the world to apply changes.

EFFECT._comment: Status effect names - some may use DoD.* keys in future if added to core Dragonbane
